snippet.title: Judiciary Act of 1789 \- Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia
snippet.description: The United States Judiciary Act of 1789 (ch. 20, 1 Stat. 73) was a landmark statute adopted on September 24, 1789, in the first session of the First United States Congress. It established the U.S. federal judiciary. Article III, Section 1 of the ...

snippet.title: Origins of the Federal Judiciary: Essays on the Judiciary ...
snippet.description: This volume of essays analyzes the Act from political and legal perspectives while enhancing our understanding of the history of the judiciary and its role in the constitutional interpretation.

snippet.title: Kaplan AP U.S. History 2009 - Page 95
snippet.description: Washington appointed Thomas Jefferson as secretary of state, Alexander Hamilton as secretary of the treasury, Henry Knox as secretary of war, and Edmund Randolph as attorney general (appointed after the Judiciary Act of 1789).
